TopicTitle: I think we should have the Unofficial name for kerbin be ComplexPlanet.cpp

Articles.Content:
I was looking around the web and i found this.

http://libnoise.sourceforge.net/examples/complexplanet/index.html

It's an example of planet generation. If you look closely it's kerbin flipped backwards. So who is in favor of this unofficial name?
Why do we need two names? So would you say "Oh yea, I just went to the Mun and back to (Say in Dalek Voice) ComplexPlanet.CPP"?

KSP is actually using a unity port of LibNoise, so LibNoiseUnity.unitypackage might be a more accurate name.

http://forum.unity3d.com/threads/68764-LibNoise-Ported-to-Unity
Wow... I want the landscape and detail on that planed 8)
i think the best unoffcial name, is the same as its offical one.
This would be true if we were posting before the 0.14 update. Much has changed with Kerbin since I the implementation of the better looking PQS terrain system in 0.14.2.
Hmm. Perhaps this is the reason KSC isn't at longitude 0?
Contrary to popular belief, 0,0 is not an island. It is however a huge ocean. I had a bug that teleported one of my ships there and its in the water.
